title: Provides for free hunting, fishing and trapping licenses to residents of the state who are active duty members of the U.S. armed forces regardless of duty station
summary: Provides for free hunting, fishing and trapping licenses to residents of the state who are active duty members of the U.S. armed forces regardless of where such person is stationed.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1909

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. GIGLIO, CASTELLI, SCHROEDER -- Multi-Sponsored by
         -- M. of A. CORWIN -- read once and referred to the Committee on Envi-
         ronmental Conservation

       AN  ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to free
         hunting, fishing and trapping licenses  to  state  residents  who  are
         active duty members of the United States armed services

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision 2  of  section  11-0715  of  the  environmental
    2  conservation  law,  as  amended by section 3 of part KK of chapter 59 of
    3  the laws of 2009, is amended to read as follows:
    4    2. A member of the Shinnecock tribe  or  the  Poospatuck  tribe  or  a
    5  member  of the six nations, residing on any reservation wholly or partly
    6  within the state, is entitled  to  receive  free  of  charge  a  fishing
    7  license,  a  small  and big game license, a sportsman license, a muzzle-
    8  loading stamp, a trapping license, and a bow hunting stamp;  a  resident
    9  of the state who is a member of the United States armed forces in active
   10  service  [who is not] REGARDLESS OF WHERE HE OR SHE IS stationed [within
   11  the state and has not been herein longer than thirty days  on  leave  or
   12  furlough],  is  entitled  to receive free of charge a fishing license, a
   13  small and big game license, and a trapping license; a  resident  of  the
   14  state  who  is an active member of the organized militia of the state of
   15  New York as defined by section one of the military law, or  the  reserve
   16  components  of  the  armed  forces  of  the United States, and excluding
   17  members of the inactive national guard and individual ready reserve,  is
   18  entitled  to  receive  free of charge a fishing license, a small and big
   19  game license, and a trapping license; and a resident  who  is  blind  is
   20  entitled  to  receive a fishing license free of charge. For the purposes
   21  of this subdivision a person is blind only if either:  (a)  his  or  her
   22  central  visual  acuity  does  not  exceed 20/200 in the better eye with
   23  correcting lenses, or (b) his or  her  visual  acuity  is  greater  than

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD03447-01-1

       A. 1909                             2

    1  20/200  but  is  accompanied by a limitation of the field of vision such
    2  that the widest diameter of the visual field subtends an angle no great-
    3  er than 20 degrees.
    4    A  resident in the state for a period of thirty days immediately prior
    5  to the date of application who has attained the age of seventy is  enti-
    6  tled  to  receive  a  sportsman  license at the cost of ten dollars as a
    7  license fee.
    8    A resident in the state for a period of thirty days immediately  prior
    9  to  the date of application who has attained the age of seventy is enti-
   10  tled to receive a fishing license, and a trapping license, at a cost  of
   11  five dollars for each license.
   12    A  resident in the state for a period of thirty days immediately prior
   13  to the date of application who has attained the age of seventy is  enti-
   14  tled  to  receive free of charge a bowhunting stamp and a muzzle-loading
   15  stamp.
   16    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the environmental conservation law, in relation to free hunting, fishing and trapping licenses to state residents who are active duty members of the United States armed services
